James C. Wood pamphlets and reprints
1890-1947

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The provenance of the items in this collection is uncertain.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, James C. Wood pamphlets and reprints, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: James C. Wood was a professor of obstetrics and diseases of women and children at the University of Michigan Homeopathic Medical College.

scopecontent.p: This collection of pamphlets and reprints of the writings of James C. Wood was gathered together from different sources. The collection is arranged alphabetically by title.

Epilepsy as a histero-neurosis, 1891. Gynecological clinic, University of Michigan Homeopathic department, Session of 1890-1891, 1891

An ideal summer outing, 1907

The lady or the dog, 1936
Man and his physician, 1928
The medical and surgical treatment of peritonitis, 1899
Neurasthenia of long standing, the result of numerous lesions with the pelvis-abdomen operation--recovery after prolonged convalescence, 1906

The other side of the question, undated
Philosophical thoughts on medicine, 1937
The practical application of organotherapy, 1921
Profound lesions within the pelvis resulting from gonorrhea giving rise to distressing indigestion, mal-nutrition, etc., undated
The proposed amalgamation of the homeopathic and regular departments of the University of Michigan: A protest

Rhinophyma, 1911
Sterility in women, 1935
Then and now, 1825-1925. A medical drama in two acts, 1926

The use of the spray in the local treatment of gynecological diseases, 1901
"Whither homeopathy?" 1929
A year's surgical work, 1902
